intro: Veratrum mengtzeanum, commonly known as the Mengtzean lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the genus Veratrum, which is part of the family Melanthiaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. The plant contains various toxic alkaloids, which have historically been used in traditional medicine but require careful handling due to its potent effects.
